issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: bundle-instance fails with duplicate bucket name and prefix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Hi All,

Running euca-bundle-instance with the following command

$ euca-bundle-instance -b windows-bundle-1 -p windows-2008 -o $EC2_ACCESS_KEY -w $EC2_SECRET_KEY i-17D03F11

Gives following error message and refuse to bundle the instance

BundleInstanceType: Can't create the requested bucket

The bucket in question (windows-bundle-1) exists on Walrus, if it is not there, bundling works correctly.

Error observed in cloud-output.log on Walrus

{code}
Mon Aug 20 03:31:29 2012  INFO Exceptions              | The requested bucket name is not available. The bucket namespace is shared by all users of the system. Please select a different name and try again.
Mon Aug 20 03:31:29 2012  INFO Exceptions              | Failed to send message  to service BukkitInternal because: The requested bucket name is not available. The bucket namespace is shared by all users of the system. Please select a different name and try again.
Mon Aug 20 03:31:29 2012 ERROR VmControl               | java.lang.RuntimeException: Can't create the requested bucket
{code}

Same thing on AWS EC2 works without any problem.

1. Create a bucket with the name windows-bundle-1
2. Run a instance store backed windows 2003 instance on  AWS
3. Run bundle-instance as shown below

euca-bundle-instance -b windows-bundle-1 -p windows-2003 -o $EC2_ACCESS_KEY -w $EC2_SECRET_KEY i-a1aa2292

Bundling finishes without any problem.

BUNDLE	bun-b2fd7082	i-a1aa2292	windows-bundle-1	windows-2003	2012-08-20T09:05:23+0000	2012-08-20T09:58:28+0000	complete


Please let me know if there are any further questions.

Cheers!
Deependra
fields.summary: euca-bundle-instance does not work if the bucket already exists on Walrus

comments.body:
Starting investigation.  

Setup is as follows:

*HA Environment*

2 x CLC/Walrus
2 x CC
1 x SC
5 x NC

Confirmed. *Steps to Reproduce* 1) Start a Windows instance {code} [root@viking-01 ~]# euca-describe-images | grep windows IMAGE emi-F61536F3 windows2003r2_x64/windowsserver2003r2_ent_x64.kvm.img.manifest.xml 345590850920 available public i386 machine windows instance-store [root@viking-01 ~]# euca-describe-instances i-06EA4433 RESERVATION r-E356433F 345590850920 default INSTANCE i-06EA4433 emi-F61536F3 euca-192-168-55-102.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com euca-10-106-69-151.eucalyptus.internal running admin 0 m1.small 2012-09-10T18:56:12.678Z enter-the-wu monitoring-disabled euca-192-168-55-102.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com euca-10-106-69-151.eucalyptus.internal instance-store {code} 2) Run {code}euca-bundle-instance{code} with appropriate flags (passed --debug option to show debugging information): {code} [root@viking-01 ~]# euca-bundle-instance -b windows2003r2_x64 -p windowssrv2003r2x64 -o $EC2_ACCESS_KEY -w $EC2_SECRET_KEY --debug i-06EA4433 2012-09-10 13:33:15,182 euca2ools [DEBUG]:Method: POST 2012-09-10 13:33:15,182 euca2ools [DEBUG]:Path:
